sanskrit_verse:
नाविस्पष्टमधीयीत न शूद्रजनसन्निधौ ।
न निशान्ते परिश्रान्तो ब्रह्माधीत्य पुनः स्वपेत् ॥ ४.९९॥
transliteration:
nāvispaṣṭamadhīyīta na śūdrajanasannidhau |
na niśānte pariśrānto brahmādhītya punaḥ svapet || 4.99||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must not study the Veda unclearly, nor in proximity to Shudra individuals; one must not sleep again after studying Brahma, especially when fatigued at night's end.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority of Vedic study is preserved through clarity and purity of environment
Causation arises from intentional alignment with sacred knowledge
Capacity-based responsibility requires physical and mental preparedness for scriptural engagement
Restoration logic demands removal of distractions and impurities during learning
Consciousness alignment necessitates disciplined regulation of bodily states
executable_legal_axioms: IF a student engages Vedas without clarity OR in presence of socially uninitiated persons THEN access must be paused until purification protocols complete
IF fatigue occurs post-Vedic study AND nighttime has ended THEN further rest is disallowed to maintain energetic integrity of learning
IF Vedic recitation is detected near unauthorized listeners THEN immediate spatial separation protocol activates
IF consciousness coherence drops below threshold during study THEN automatic alert triggers spiritual supervision interface
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving ritual violations or educational misconduct, courts must recognize that improper conduct during Vedic study constitutes a breach of ontological capacity rather than moral failing. The hierarchy of authority places Vedic preservation above social convenience. Restoration involves retraining correct environmental conditions and temporal discipline.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa shows that defective study conditions produce defective cognition, which disrupts causal sequence toward Self-realization. Anupūrvaśaḥ demonstrates how flawed learning environments propagate error chains. Proportional responsibility lies in restoring proper methodology. Non-punitive reality rule confirms suffering does not arise from misaligned practice but from ignorance of its natural consequences.
